title.narrative: 4.1 POLICY IMPLEMENTATION AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: 4.1 Government has improved evidence and capacity to ensure child protection policy implementation and coordination., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, fewer children experience physical and sexual violence, abuse and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 Government has improved evidence and capacity to ensure child protection policy implementation and coordination.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support improved Government capacity to progressively harmonize the legal and policy framework in Sierra Leone with universal child rights standards and to ensure effective policy implementation and coordination for managing child protection cases. This has been further strengthened with continued national consultations and advances in the revision of the Child Rights Act and handover of the Primero case management system to the Ministry of Gender and Children’s Affairs (MGCA) and the Department of Science, Technology and Innovation (DSTI). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
